instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
HI,

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B, that recognizes the battery, works on charger (if it has a bit of battery), says that it is charging, but the battery won't charge. 

Already tried with a good working battery, but with the same result.

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Magsafe light is green, or amber?
Did you test disconnecting BIL?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Hi,
The magsafe starts green and turns to orange.
I don't know what is the BIL, but right now I'm testing it on the bench, with the board and battery only.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage, w/ and w/o battery connected.
Does it slowly increase when battery is connected?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Without battery it is 12.57V. With the battery connected it drops to 11.5V.
With the battery only (w/o charger connected it has 10.5V)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
"Does it slowly increase when battery is connected?"
Measure after few minutes, to detect if charges.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Sorry. Didn't understood at first.
Yes, it slowly increases with battery connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Then the battery is charging.

"I don't know what is the BIL"
J6955.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Tks. Apparently is the BIL cable. It works fine w/o it.
Thanks.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Hi, 
After all, it wasen't the BIL.
When the mac it's in use, it does not charge (maintain the same battery percentage), and when it's powered off, it charges, but very slowly.
Any ideas?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Did you try known good battery?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
Resistance  between pins 17/18 = 10 ohms
resistance between pins 27/28  = 20 ohms
I've tried with a good working battery already

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message:
"Resistance  between pins 17/18 = 10 ohms"
Check the schematic...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message: Not sure if i read the  schematic right, but should it be 0 ohms  between pins 17/18?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B not charging
threads.message: 2-3 ohm aprox, if I calculated correctly...
